body.section:
FF4J, stands for Feature Flipping for Java, helps you implementing the 'feature toggle' agile development practice. Features (services/behaviour/treatments/screen parts) can be enabled and disabled at runtime but also limited to an authorized sub-set of users (e.g : beta-testers for beta feature). Once the feature is enabled and granted you can implement your own strategy to flip through custom FlippingStrategy.
The library provides :
different ways to store the features : InMemory, inDatabase, remotely through HTTP
different ways to access features at runtime : WebConsole, JMX, REST Services
security to grant accesses with Spring Security
cache to limit overhead of accessing store (http or db)
both static (singleton bean) and prototype to allow Inversion of Control
native integration to Spring Framework
But also :
Performs flipping through AOP instead of if/then/else everywhere in your code.
